section.title: ColourScales Commands
section.para: Define colourscales to colour objects. Each colourscale has a number of points defining colours at specific values - between adjacent points the colour is linearly interpolated. Points in a colourscale are numbered from 1 onwards. There are ten available colourscales, with IDs 1-10. Some of these have specific uses within Aten.

listitem.para: ((Colourscales)) for a discussion of colourscales and how they may be used within Aten.

section.title: addpoint

listitem.para: addpoint ( int id, double value, double r, double g, double b )
addpoint ( int id, double value, double r, double g, double b, double alpha )

section.para: Adds a new point to the end of the specified colourscale, at the point ''value'' and with the RGB[A] colour provided.
For example:
adds a point to colourscale 1 at a value of 15.0 in a nasty green colour.

section.title: clearpoints
section.para: Clears all points from the specified colourscale.
For example:
clears all points from the third colourscale.

section.title: scalename
section.para: Retrieves the name of the colourscale id provided, or sets the name if a new name is provided). The name is displayed next to the gradient bar (if drawn).
For example:
renames the first colourscale to 'Orientation'.

section.title: scalevisible
section.para: Sets whether the gradient bar for the specified colourscale should be drawn in the main view. Default is 'off' for all colourscales.
For example:
draws the gradient bar for the 9th colourscale in the main view.

section.title: setpoint

listitem.para: setpoint ( int id, int point, double value, double r, double g, double b )
setpoint ( int id, int point, double value, double r, double g, double b, double alpha )

section.para: Sets the value and colour of an existing point in the specified colourscale.
For example:
sets the second point on colourscale 1 to a value of -3.3 and white colour.

section.title: setpointcolour

listitem.para: setpointcolour ( int id, int point, double r, double g, double b )
setpointcolour ( int id, int point, double r, double g, double b, double alpha )

section.para: Sets the colour of an existing point in the specified colourscale.
For example:
sets the first point on colourscale 5 to be coloured blue.

section.title: setpointvalue

listitem.para: setpointvalue ( int id, int point, double value )

section.para: Sets the value of an existing point in the specified colourscale.
For example:
sets the third point of colourscale 4 to a value of 0.1.
